artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Yamamotoya Heikichi
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: vertical ōban triptych;bind in a book with 96.146.106*
inscription: Names of characters written aside each person: right: 錦乾女 {Kinshōjo} | middle:  延平王国性爺 {Enpeiō Kokusen\'ya} | left: 伍将軍甘輝 {Gojōgun Kanki}
markings: red artist\'s toshidama seal (R) | on each sheet, censor seals: 浜 {Hama} | 馬込 {Magome} | シタ賣 {shita-uri} | publisher\'s seal: {Yama-hisa}
medium: Woodblock prints (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: R:  一陽齋豊國 {Ichiyōsai Toyokuni} | in toshidama cartouche, L, C: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
text: Related to the play "Kokusen'ya kassen" 国性爺合戦 (The Battle of Coxinga), performed at the Nakamura Theater, 1850, 5th month.
title: Actors Bandō Shūka I as Kinshōjo (R), Ichikawa Danjūrō VIII as Enpeiō Kokusen'ya (C), and Ichikawa Ebizō V as Gojōgun Kanki (L)
